subject: AI & Agents
title: The Data Hunger Myth
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Data Hunger Myth.

hook.text: People say 'AI needs big data.' But some of the best AI techniques work with surprisingly little.

buildup.text: Traditional deep learning devours data. But transfer learning and foundation models changed the equation.

discovery.text: A model pre-trained on billions of words can be fine-tuned for a new task with just hundreds of examples.

twist.text: Quality matters more than quantity. Curated small datasets often outperform massive noisy ones.

climax.text: Techniques like few-shot prompting require zero fine-tuning data at all â€” just clear instructions.

punchline.text: Big data started the revolution. Smart data is finishing it.

quiz.question: How has transfer learning changed AI's data requirements?
options: Pre-trained models can be adapted with much smaller datasets
It requires even more data than before
Transfer learning doesn't work in practice
